plot: August 1918: Deserted by the baby's father, Ethel has been installed with her child in a cottage on the estate by a sympathetic Mrs. Hughes, who brings her food. Jane, a war widow, has taken Ethel's place as a maid. Vera Bates returns, having spent John's money.—don @ minifie-1

Everyone at Downton Abbey is shocked by the news that both Matthew and William have been seriously injured at the front. While Matthew is on his way to the family home home for treatment and recuperation, they are told that William cannot convalesce at the Abbey as it is for officers only.—garykmcd

Matthew and William return from the war - Matthew permanently paralyzed and William dying. A village war widow joins the staff, the major who fathered Ethel's trial turns his back on her, and despite taking Bates' money, Vera breaks her blackmail agreement.—duke1029

August 1918. Matthew is paralyzed from the waist down by serious spinal injury and told that he will never walk again or father children. He tells Lavinia to forget him and sends her away as regret would creep in later, while Mary attempts to nurse him back to health.—KGF Vissers
